content:
advertisement

State College psychologist Richard Lenhart has been issued a formal disciplinary action filed by the Pennsylvania State Board of Psychology in relation to possible inappropriate sexual relationships with two patients PERIOD

Lenharts license to practice psychology was temporarily suspended in November by the Probable Cause Screening Committee of the State Board of Psychology after the initial accusations of misconduct PERIOD According to the 79page disciplinary action filed on Jan PERIOD  the board has detailed  counts of professional misconduct against Lenhart PERIOD

Lenhart faces fines of up to  for each violation as well as the cost of investigation according to the documents PERIOD

According to the documents the board is also authorized to suspend or revoke Lenharts license for the misconduct PERIOD

The documents give Lenhart  days to file a response to the charges PERIOD Lenhart had been practicing psychology for more than  years and had an office on Pugh Street PERIOD

One patient who is only identified with the initials A.M. in the documents was treated by Lenhart for seven years and eventually developed an inappropriate and harmful personal and sexual relationship according to the documents PERIOD

Lenhart treated the other patient identified in the documents as N.M. for more than  years and developed a similar relationship according to the documents PERIOD Both of the identified individuals were also originally being treated by Lenhart in part because of prior sexual trauma according to the documents PERIOD

Other than the development of a sexual relationship with the two patients the documents cite other forms of misconduct including Lenhart disclosing personal information about himself with the patients eventually supporting him in his own personal issues PERIOD

Lenhart could not be reached for comment as of press time Wednesday PERIOD
